newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo rubber futures mostly up in slow trade.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo rubber futures mostly up in slow trade.

text.p: Tokyo rubber futures ended firmer on Thursday, except for the spot February, with activity dominated by position-adjustment in slow trade, traders said.
Prices ranged from 0.1 yen per kg lower to 0.3 yen up. Benchmark June contract was up 0.1 yen at 143.7 yen.

In early trade, prices were trapped within tight ranges as the yen's weaker tendency against the dollar was offset by easier demand in rubber-producing countries ahead of the Chinese New Year. Market energy ebbed later as private investors then retreated to the sidelines on seeing the yen's recovery against the dollar.
